pullRequest.body:
and prove that these contain (commutative) `(Add)NormedGroup`s. This allows generalising results from normed spaces/normed groups to `ENNReal` also.

A future PR will generalise lemmas in mathlib to use these new classes. This PR only changes a few lemmas, to prove that these definitions are set up right.

From the Carleson project.

---------

There is a [zulip thread](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/287929-mathlib4/topic/Importing.20ENNReal.20in.20normed.20groups) for discussing the large import.
Re-done version of #21422.

- [ ] depends on: #22215 (to fix an unrelated simpNF linter timeout downstream, exposed by this PR)

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

Import changes exceeding 2%

| %      | File |
| -      | -    |
| +12.75% | `Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Group.Basic` |

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Group.Basic | 1020 | 1150 | +130 (+12.75%) |

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
|<details><summary>5 files</summary> `Mathlib.Analysis.SpecialFunctions.Log.ERealExp` `Mathlib.Analysis.SpecialFunctions.Trigonometric.Chebyshev` `Mathlib.Data.Complex.Exponential` `Mathlib.Data.Complex.Norm` `Mathlib.Data.Complex.Trigonometric`</details>|4|

| `Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Affine.Simplex`|24|
| `Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Group.AddTorsor`|25|

| `Mathlib.NumberTheory.DirichletCharacter.Bounds`|47|
| `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.Matrix.Gershgorin`|48|
| `Mathlib.Analysis.Polynomial.CauchyBound` `Mathlib.Topology.MetricSpace.CauSeqFilter`|52|
| `Mathlib.Analysis.Asymptotics.Defs` `Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Field.Basic`|53|
| `Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Group.Int`|114|
| `Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Group.CocompactMap`|119|
| `Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Group.Submodule`|121|
| `Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Group.Subgroup`|127|
| `Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Group.Constructions` `Mathlib.Analysis.NormedSpace.MStructure`|129|
|<details><summary>5 files</summary> `Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Group.Basic` `Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Order.Hom.Basic` `Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Order.Hom.Ultra` `Mathlib.Analysis.NormedSpace.IndicatorFunction` `Mathlib.InformationTheory.Hamming`</details>|130|

</details>

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ ContinuousAt.enorm`
`+ ContinuousENorm`
`+ ENormedAddCommMonoid`

`+ ENormedCommMonoid`
`+ ENormedMonoid`
`+ Inseparable.enorm_eq_enorm'`
`+ NormedCommGroup.toENormedCommMonoid`
`+ NormedGroup.toENormedMonoid`
`+ SeminormedGroup.toContinuousENorm`
`+ continuous_enorm`
`- Continuous.enorm'`
`- ContinuousAt.enorm'`
`- continuous_enorm'`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

> All you need is `ENNReal.isOpenEmbedding_coe`, right? Does reducing imports to `Topology.Instances.ENNReal.Defs` until it proves not much more than `ENNReal.isOpenEmbedding_coe` bring the import increase to a reasonable amount?

I just tried: you can pare down `ENNReal.Defs` to the absolute minimum, which is this.
```
/-
Copyright (c) 2017 Johannes H√∂lzl. All rights reserved.
Released under Apache 2.0 license as described in the file LICENSE.
Authors: Johannes H√∂lzl
-/
import Mathlib.Topology.Instances.NNReal.Defs

/-!
# Topology on extended non-negative reals
-/

noncomputable section

open Metric Set Topology
open scoped NNReal

namespace ENNReal

/-- Topology on `‚Ñù‚â•0‚àû`.

Note: this is different from the `EMetricSpace` topology. The `EMetricSpace` topology has
`IsOpen {‚àû}`, while this topology doesn't have singleton elements. -/
instance : TopologicalSpace ‚Ñù‚â•0‚àû := Preorder.topology ‚Ñù‚â•0‚àû

instance : OrderTopology ‚Ñù‚â•0‚àû := ‚ü®rfl‚ü©

theorem isEmbedding_coe : IsEmbedding ((‚Üë) : ‚Ñù‚â•0 ‚Üí ‚Ñù‚â•0‚àû) :=
  coe_strictMono.isEmbedding_of_ordConnected <| by rw [range_coe']; exact ordConnected_Iio

end ENNReal
```

That leaves a very incoherent file, though - a `PreDefs.lean` file, so to speak. How would you deal with this?
Create a new file `Defs.lean` (the one above) and rename the current `Defs.lean` to `Basic.lean`?
I'm trying the import split in #22093

I have cherry-picked the import changes here.
`shake` hasn't run yet (but didn't have further changes on the other branch): so far it looks like we just get a reduction by 4 transitive imports (from 129 added to 125 added). Sure, I'd take that, but it's a bit disappointing. (The split might still be worth it... what do you think, @YaelDillies?)
It seems to me the split is not worth it. Probably, we simply do need these `ENNReal` results in normed spaces, which doesn't seem so unreasonable to me. Have you asked about it on Zulip?
I [have asked](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/287929-mathlib4/topic/Importing.20ENNReal.20in.20normed.20groups) on zulip.

While I can imagine some further import reductions are possible (see e.g. [the discussion on the other PR](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/22093#issuecomment-2670785335)), I don't think it will be possible to avoid *any* transitive import increase. After all, new material is needed here.

I am stymied by the simpNF linter error: let's revert the import changes (which, in my understanding, shouldn't land anyway as they don't give as much benefit; an import reduction should happen differently).
Update: that didn't help.

@JovanGerb Can I summon your magical diagnostic powers again, please? This PR makes the simpNF time out in `Mathlib.RingTheory.LocalRing.ResidueField.Ideal`, far downstream of what this PR modifies. The error message is `failed to synthesize FaithfulSMul R I.ResidueField`. Typing `#synth FaithfulSMul R I.ResidueField` just above that declaration with the error, I can reproduce this locally, but have no idea where this comes from.

Thanks a lot for any help you have time to provide!

The issue is that `FaithfulSMul.ker_algebraMap_eq_bot` a more general simp lemma that also applies whenever `Ideal.ker_algebraMap_residueField` does. Changing the priorities so that that lemma has a lower priority fixes this problem.

However this is a more general problem with `simp`. Discrimination tree lookup gives the result (generally) in order from most general to most specific match. Type class search is smart and traverses this array backwards. `simp` is not so smart at traverses the array forwards, meaning that more general lemmas are tried before more specific lemmas. In this case that leads to this problem.

This PR/issue depends on:
* leanprover-community/mathlib4#22215
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ü§ñ). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

@YaelDillies Do you happen to have some time to review this PR (except from the imports side)? This PR is becoming a bottle-neck for some of my work on the carleson project, so it would be great to land it soon. (This is not your personal responsibility, if you are busy I can ask others. But you took an earlier look already.)
I will turn to the imports question later today; it is not being forgotten!

All you need is `ENNReal.isOpenEmbedding_coe`, right? Does reducing imports to `Topology.Instances.ENNReal.Defs` until it proves not much more than `ENNReal.isOpenEmbedding_coe` bring the import increase to a reasonable amount?

All you need is `ENNReal.isOpenEmbedding_coe`, right? Does reducing imports to `Topology.Instances.ENNReal.Defs` until it proves not much more than `ENNReal.isOpenEmbedding_coe` bring the import increase to a reasonable amount?
This import increase is needed to speak of a topological space structure on `ENNReal`.
The only way I see to avoid this is to move these definitions to `Continuity.lean`.

Yael pointed out that this import was already added back in #20966 (for the same reason), and only removed in #21554 (which split that file). Hence, I would argue that keeping ENNReal out of `Basic.lean` only worked in the short-term, and this import is really needed.
```suggestion

```suggestion
  protected enorm_add_le : ‚àÄ x y : E, ‚Äñx + y‚Äñ‚Çë ‚â§ ‚Äñx‚Äñ‚Çë + ‚Äñy‚Äñ‚Çë
```
Can this become an earlier section?
I have moved this result to an earlier section. The other results (the instances or the continuity statement) cannot, since they require material from a section further down).

```suggestion
    ‚Äña‚Äñ‚Çë ‚â† 0 ‚Üî a ‚â† 1 := enorm_eq_zero'.ne
```

```suggestion
    0 < ‚Äña‚Äñ‚Çë ‚Üî a ‚â† 1 := pos_iff_ne_zero.trans enorm_ne_zero'
```

pullRequest.title: feat: add classes `ContinuousENorm` and `ENormed(Add)(Comm)Monoid`
